result.execSummary:
The defendant William J. Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William J. Lewis is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William J. Lewis was found guilty of Delivery of Methamphetamine (<=3g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**Court orders 1 day credit, if revoked** 
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Dunn County cases 17CF313, 20CF45, 22CF149

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William J. Lewis

records.addlTxt: Disposition of Count 2 amended from Dismissed and Read in to Dismissed.

Order Amending Judgment of Conviction
Upon the stipulation of the parties, the court herein orders that the Judgment of Conviction previously entered in this matter be amended by striking the words "Dismissed but read in" and inserting the word "Dismissed" as the disposition to Count 2 of the Information.
Proposed Order Amending Judgment of Conviction
Stipulation to Amend Judgment of Conviction

(Case called at 1:46 PM- by Zoom) Defendant William J. Lewis appeared by video, in custody from Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard appeared by video for William J. Lewis.  Attorney Peter J. Rindal appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates he will file the plea paperwork immediately. Defendant waives right to personal appearance. Defense recites the joint sentence recommendation. State makes clarifications to the agreement. Defense and Defendant agree. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1- Possession of Methamphetamine as Second or Subsequent Offense and as Repeater. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. Defendant makes a statement. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 4 years Probation concurrent to Dunn County cases 17CF313, 20CF45, 22CF149. Court orders the following conditions of probation: AODA and follow through with recommendations; No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs including $70 in West Central Drug Task Force buy funds. Court orders 1 day credit, if revoked. 
Court orders that the payments can be set up on a payment plan to being the 1st of the month following the Defendant's release from custody. 
Parties may file a stipulation regarding Count 2 if necessary at a later date.
Plea hearing on October 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea hearing on October 6, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

9:34am Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for William J. Lewis. Defendant William J. Lewis appeared by phone, in custody from Dodge Correctional. 

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 

Case referred to Br. 3 for scheduling.
Notice of Hearing - Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward

Conditions: 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications.

(Case called at 11:12 AM- by Zoom) Defendant William Lewis appears in custody via video conference from the Dunn County Jail without counsel. ADA Tiffany Winter appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant is executed. Defendant updates phone number. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 05/25/2022 at 2:45 PM. 
Hearing: 06/21/2022 at 9:30 AM.
